Name: Lighthouse
Description: A lighthouse is a fixed structure typically on a coastline or waterway designed and built to emit light from a system of lamps and lenses and used as a navigation aid for mariners and pilots at sea.

Properties.Name: Automated date
Properties.Description: Date or Year that the lighthouse lantern was automated with a modern strobe light assembly.

Properties.Name: Construction material
Properties.Description: The construction material used for the structure of this lighthouse.

Properties.Name: Focal height of light
Properties.Description: Height of the light above mean sea-level (it's Focal Height).

Properties.Name: Light intensity
Properties.Description: Light intensity. This is different from Range.

Properties.Name: Light attributes
Properties.Description: Links to compound value that holds the Light characteristic type, sequence duration, and any remarks

Properties.Name: Light color range
Properties.Description: Links to compound value that holds Light color(s) and range(s).

Properties.Name: Light sequence
Properties.Description: Links to compound value that holds the lighthouses' flash sequence in seconds, and the eclipse seconds (dark seconds).

Properties.Name: Out of service date
Properties.Description: Date the Lighthouse became non-operational and was classified as out of service. This is a useful property for those lighthouses that are still standing historic structures but no longer emit a light beam.

Properties.Name: Tower shape
Properties.Description: The general shape or form used in the lighthouses' tower design (Pyramidal, Conical, etc)

Properties.Name: Year first lit
Properties.Description: Year that the lighthouse's lantern was first lit (Considered for historical reference versus the year the lantern assembly was Automated)
